etymologies: late Middle English (originally denoting various bracket fungi with medicinal or other uses): from Latin agaricum, from Greek agarikon ‘tree fungus’

definitions: a fungus with a fruiting body that resembles the ordinary mushroom, having a convex or flattened cap with gills on the underside.

notes.text: Order Agaricales, class Basidiomycetes, in particular the mushroom family Agaricaceae

shortDefinitions: fungus with fruiting body that resembles mushroom, having convex or flattened cap with gills on underside
